alert.note: Alert for Valley (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 11 at 9:18PM MDT until further notice by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Glasgow MT has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Montana... Milk River at Tampico affecting Valley County. .Warm temperatures will melt the existing snowpack, leading to increased runoff and river flows. For the Milk River...including Saco, Tampico, Malta, Dodson, Glasgow, Nashua...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Milk River at Tampico. * WHEN...From late tonight until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 24.0 feet, North Tampico Road north of the river begins to flood. . At 25.5 feet, County gravel roads north of the Milk River become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM MDT Tuesday the stage was 21.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tonight and continue rising to a crest of 26.9 feet early Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 23.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 27.0 feet on 04/25/2018. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 1000 AM MDT.
